title.narrative: 3.2 INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY BUILDING

description.narrative: Public duty bearers for education at provincial and district levels, with strengthened capacity, are delivering child friendly schooling to the most disadvantaged children., which contributes to Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, Pakistan's most disadvantaged children, especially girls and minority groups, are participating in structured early learning and completing ten years of quality education.

participating-org.narrative: NATIONAL PROGRAMME FOR FP AND PHC

sector.narrative: Provision of parental education for school readiness (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision or procurement of primary education learning materials

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Public duty bearers for education at provincial and district levels, with strengthened capacity, are delivering child friendlyschooling to the most disadvantaged children.

description.narrative: Capacity building benefited over 24,000 (58 per cent women) education staff from schools, ALPs and district government. UNICEF direct support to ALP and ECE scale-up provided learning opportunities to nearly 26,000 children and adolescents (46 per cent girls) in 559 ALPs, and an estimated 38,000 children in ECE classes. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2017
